column4: so any ideas what i should look for in the dmesg output as being the reason my serial modem can connect in the live cd but not my install?
compare the two files and look for differences in the "ttySX" lines
X stands for a port number
i checked and the ports match, i forgot to say that there are two modems on this pc, i am using the winmodem right now, i think maybe it might have somthing to do with that?
so your hardware is recognized in exactly the same way in your hdd install and from the livecd?
what do you mean? for the serial modem i did not have to do much just do mome minor stuff, the winmodem needed i got to work with a driver install

maybe i don't understand your problem right. i was under the impression that your modem works right from your hdd install and does not work from the live cd. or the other way around. and that you suspected it is not properly detected
it works from the live cd but will not work from the install
and the hardware (both modems) are recognized in exactly the same way?
could you expalin what you mean?

in the files someone suggested you to look at you can see which hardware gets recognized by the kernel. ttyS0, ttyS1 are the names linux uses for serial ports. my question is if both times they get recognized in the same way
i still can't understand what the problem is and what you do differently in both cases
yes they have the exact info, and diffrence is that i had already installed the driver for the winmodem
and after installing this driver the other modem stopped working?
i did not have the serial modem when i installed the driver, and that is why i wonder if it has something to do with that

another thing is that the live cd uses kernel 2.6.15-23, the install uses kernel 2.6.15-28, i thiught this could be a prob but changed kernel's at boot to try the serial and it still did not work, so i don't think it's the kernel

that's ok man, i've learned that modems are pain to work with, i spent two weeks getting my winmodem to work, which i am running under the older kernel because the driver won't work with the new kernel, even though i compiled a new one
i'm happy that it works now for you (anyhow) :-)
